Text: From 1949 to March 10, 1967, France's military operated within the NATO command structure, integrating its air defense system (the "Défense Aérienne du Territoire" (D.A.T.)) with that of NATO through the indirect use of American aid funds.
Triplets:<France

--------------------
Text: NATO Ouvrage "G":  Between 1953 and 1958, the D.A.T. built a radar station in an old troops shelter (in French : "abri-caverne") near the fort, called "Ouvrage ""G"".
Triplets:<NATO Ouvrage
4:
--------------------
<Text: NATO Ouvrage "G":  Ouvrage "G" was equipped with seven radar antennas installed on top of the fort.>
Triplets:<NATO Ouvrage "G"
5:
--------------------
Text: NATO Ouvrage "G":  The principal radars are presently located on the Ballon de Servance.
